description.narrative:
The OPT CO safe programming focal points and the newly recruited Partnership Coordinator will be preparing, designing, and leading/facilitating the trainings that will be conducted to up to 20-25 Palestinian CBOs and CSOs staff in the Gaza Strip and the West Bank. Note that the timeframe will be agreed at OPA stage.
• The training will align with Oxfam’s safe programming training module and RRR horizon plan utilising the TOT training module, which the 2 OPT CO staff attended. The training will be conducted online and/or face to face (considering COVID-19 restrictive measures/circumstances). The training will be interactive and include joint analysis,sharing lessons learning, scenario planning and risk analysis/mitigation. • The training module will be adapted to the Palestinian context and partner organisation’s needs and expectations. It will be conducted in Arabic. • A series of 2–3-hour training workshopswill be conducted for selected partners in the Gaza Strip and the West Bank. Selected partner staff (training participants) may actas designated focal points for their organizations and Oxfam Safe Programming focal points may continue to be their mentors and advisors for a specific period of time after the training. • The partners will be nominated and selected by the Programme Leads (Economic Justice, Gender Justice and Saving Lives) in collaboration with the 2 safe programming focal points and the Partnership Coordinator.
As per the PPL TOR on Safe Programming, the OPT Safe Programming focal points will work collaboratively with the safe programming officer from OGB who will dedicate 50% of her/his time to support countries in the implementation of activities and defining an approach to coach senior managers and leaders. Also, the OPT CO safe programming focal points will maintain engagement with the RRR convener for support from experienced people trained and/or safe programming experts from the GHT or other affiliates. They will alsoparticipate in monthly calls with safe programming leads/focal points from the 10 fragile countries to share views and experiences.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novibs main office is based in The Netherlands, itsupports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fund raising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s head office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

description.narrative: CSOs representing excluded and marginalised individuals have strengthened capacity and maintain and expand their civic space.
CSOs with improved organizational and technical capacity to act and to maintain and expand civic space
CSOs with improved organizational and technical capacity to act in favour of equality and equity
